page.title: 01 INTRODUCING LAUNCESTON
page.content: Approaching Launceston you see the {Norman Castle}and the parish church. Many buildings are clustered around them with new estates extending outwards. It was the capital of Cornwall but now it is thought of as the Gateway to Cornwall. The town is in three parts; St. Stephen's, Newport and Dunheved. It is a{Royal Borough}so it has its own standard. In the town centre is a War Memorial around which are shops, banks, offices, restaurants, hotels and a car park. Launceston is a small{market town}with a population of 6210. It is busiest on Tuesdays because that is market day, also on Fridays and Saturdays for week-end shopping. From here you can get to the Cornish coasts, Bodmin Moor and Dartmoor fairly easily. Around the town are scattered farms, woodlands and parkland.
